title: Landing page copy updates for connection/benefits and Readiness section reordering

requirements.summary: Update “After the Session” copy to remove “no ongoing relationship” while welcoming bounded connection without encouraging dependency.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/WhatToExpect.tsx under the “After the Session” subsection, the phrase asserting “no ongoing relationship” (or equivalent) is removed.
Replacement text explicitly communicates that clients should not become dependent on the practitioner/offering.
Replacement text explicitly communicates that ongoing connection/contact is welcome/possible (within appropriate boundaries), without implying an obligation or dependency.
All updated copy is in English.

file_operations.description: Revise the “After the Session” paragraph(s) to remove the “no ongoing relationship” language and replace it with English copy that (1) reinforces self-responsibility/non-dependence and (2) permits future contact/continued connection in clear, bounded terms (e.g., optional check-ins, future sessions, periodic touchpoints), without implying obligation or reliance.

requirements.summary: Reorder landing-page section render order so Readiness (<WhoThisIsFor />) appears immediately after Foundation (<WhatItIs />).
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/App.tsx, <WhoThisIsFor /> is rendered immediately after <WhatItIs />.
No landing-page section components are deleted; only ordering is changed.
The page still renders all sections (Hero, WhatItIs, WhoThisIsFor/Readiness, WhatToExpect, SessionStructure, PractitionerAuthority, PriceAndValue, EthicsAndBoundaries, ReadyToBookCTA, Footer).

file_operations.description: Change only the JSX render order of landing-page sections so <WhoThisIsFor /> is placed immediately after <WhatItIs />, keeping all other sections present and functional (copy/order change only; no deletions).

requirements.summary: Strengthen “What to Expect from The Clearing” copy to communicate concrete practical benefits while preserving readiness-filtering and existing disclaimers.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/components/WhatToExpect.tsx contains updated/expanded copy that clearly enumerates concrete, practical benefits/outcomes a participant can expect from the session.
The revised copy preserves a readiness filter (e.g., requiring willingness to engage, responsibility, discomfort tolerance) and does not read as hype-driven or manipulative.
The updated copy remains consistent with existing constraints already stated in the section (non-predictive tarot, not therapy, active engagement, not recorded, 90-minute session).
All revised/added user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Update/expand the user-facing English copy within “What to Expect from The Clearing” to more concretely describe practical, tangible outcomes (e.g., clarifying decisions, naming the real issue, surfacing patterns/choices, identifying next steps, distinguishing signal vs. noise) while maintaining the readiness filter and keeping all existing constraints/disclaimers intact (tarot is reflective/non-predictive, not therapy, active engagement, not recorded, 90 minutes).
